summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to American Express, demanding extensive financial records related to Jeffrey Epstein for the period from January 1, 2010, onward. The subpoena is part of an investigation into alleged violations of federal criminal law, including sex trafficking and related offenses.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subpoena seeks all financial records from American Express for accounts associated with Jeffrey Epstein, including his date of birth and Social Security Number.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Signed the grand jury subpoena as the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York, authorizing the demand for records.

events.title: Grand Jury Appearance Date for American Express
events.description: The subpoena commands American Express to appear before the grand jury to testify and produce records, though personal appearance is waived if records are produced by this date.

events.title: Subpoena Issuance Date
events.description: The grand jury subpoena is dated and issued to American Express, initiating the formal request for Jeffrey Epstein's financial records.

locations: United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Manhattan, New York, NY
U.S. Attorney's Office, Southern District of New York, 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
American Express, Attn: Subpoena Fulfillment, 43 Butterfield Circle, El Paso, TX 79906-5202
keyFacts: The subpoena seeks comprehensive financial records from American Express for Jeffrey Epstein from January 1, 2010, to the present, indicating an active federal investigation into his finances during that period.

The investigation involves alleged violations of 18 U.S.C. §§ 1591 (sex trafficking), 1594(c) (attempt/conspiracy to commit sex trafficking), and 2422(b) (coercion/enticement for illegal sexual activity).
The subpoena includes a non-disclosure request, asking American Express not to disclose the subpoena to any third party due to the ongoing nature of the investigation.

The requested records are extensive, covering account statements, transaction details, credit card accounts, loan files, correspondence, and any records identifying individuals with access to the accounts.
